alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cheyenne County through 445 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lorenzo, or 8 miles southwest of Sidney, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lorenzo around 440 PM MDT. Sidney and Sidney Airport around 445 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 52 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
